meanings.definition: relating to the study or cultivation of wine
meanings.sent1: The oenological club hosted a tasting event for its members.
meanings.sent2: Her oenological knowledge helped her identify the grape variety in the wine.
meanings.sent3: The oenological expert could even taste the subtle differences in the aged wines.
meanings.sent4: His oenological skills were so refined, he could almost taste the history in the wine.
meanings.sent5: The oenological journey through the vineyards was a sensory delight.

meanings.definition: of or relating to wine-making or wine tasting
meanings.sent1: The winery's oenological practices ensured the quality of their wines.
meanings.sent2: She attended an oenological workshop to learn more about wine production.
meanings.sent3: The oenological tour of the vineyard was both educational and enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: His oenological expertise was evident in the perfectly balanced flavors of the wine.
meanings.sent5: The oenological process of fermentation is crucial in wine-making.
